text: Bit of a mixed bag out there today. So I want to do a quick market update. And then I also want to apologize to you guys. There's a couple of things I have to come clean on which I'll get into in just a few minutes. So talking about the markets first, we have a lot of capitulation that's happening right now. And it's across all of the indices. Notice that we had the SP 500 that was down three quarters of a percent today. And then the Russell was down almost 2 bid back up to about 1.9. So yeah, overall some some pretty fair weakness going on. But this isn't like falling out of bed. Can't get up kind of weakness. This looks like a lot of things that have had a insane run from about April mid April until now. So it's kind of like if you were to go out and sprint as fast as you can sooner or later, even if you're that dude that can run a sub two hour marathon or whatever the hell it is, you got to take a break sooner or later. So that's kind of what this is to me. I see not a significant display of weakness across the market as I look across breath indicators. I see net highs lows. For example, is turning down net highs is absolutely coming down. But it's not diving into lows just yet. Although lows are now starting to expand.

But right now it's still in kind of this middle zone that doesn't cause for much concern in my opinion. It looks like a bit of a pullback going on on the game stop and why I need to apologize to you guys. It is because I sold my long options today. And here's what happened. The market opened and we kind of hovered around here. It didn't look like we were breaking out anywhere. So literally all I did was set an alert for anything above 2898 to get back in. And I said, eh, it looks like we're stalling out. I'm going to take the longs down. But I played a little bit of a game with the market because we all know that the market essentially knows what I think and what you think.
